Key Match Events: The Padres threatened to make the game a laugher in the first inning, when they sent nine batters to the plate against Merrill Kelly and scored four runs.
Corbin Carroll hit a leadoff homer in the first inning.
Eugenio Su√°rez snuck a grounder under Machado's glove at third base for an RBI single in the sixth.
Pre-Game Insights: D-backs manager Torey Lovullo said he wants his team to be'my absolute best for this team, and I know the team feels the same way, as well.'
Post-Match Reflections: D-backs manager Torey Lovullo said 'I don't feel great' about losing control of the team's postseason fate, but it'makes me hungry' for the next two games.
Lovullo said 'We're going to be ready to go tomorrow.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The D-backs are in a virtual three-way tie with the Mets and Braves for the National League's No. 2 Wild Card spot.
The D-backs have dropped four out of five games at the most crucial time of the year.
Others: The Padres won the game 5-3, hurting Arizona's chances of making the postseason.
The D-backs were 1-for-7 with runners in scoring position.
